titles: The five years of King Iames, or, The condition of the state of England, and the relation it had to other provinces. Written by Sr Foulk Grevill, late Lord Brook.
author: Greville, Fulke, Baron Brooke, 1554-1628.
Wilson, Arthur, 1595-1652, attributed name.
notes: The attribution, on the title page, to Lord Brooke is erroneous. The work was probably that of some partisan Presbyterian. It has been attributed to Arthur Wilson.--cf. Clark Memorial Lib. Dict. Cat.
Appeared, with additions in "The narrative history of King James for the first fourteen years", London, 1651.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: James --  I, --  King of England, 1566-1625 --  Early works to 1800.
Somerset, Frances Howard Carr, --  Countess of, 1593-1632 --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  James I, 1603-1625 --  Early works to 1800.
